t: The*pn scatterer has come up against you. Man*ld the ramparts; watch*ld the road; dress*ln for battle; collect*ld all your strength.
For*pn the Lord*s is restoring the majesty of Jacob as*ld the majesty of Israel, for*ln plunderers have plundered them and*ld ruined their branches.
The*pn shield of his mighty men is red; his*ld soldiers are clothed in scarlet. The*ln chariots come with flashing metal on*ld the day he musters them; the*ld cypress spears are brandished.
The*ln chariots race madly through the streets; they*ld rush to and fro through the squares; they*ln gleam like torches; they*ld dart like lightning.
He*ln remembers his officers; they*ld stumble as they go, they*ln hasten to the wall; the*ld siege tower is set up.
The*ln river gates are opened; the*ld palace melts away;
its*ln mistress is stripped; she is carried off, her*ld slave girls lamenting, moaning*ln like doves and*ld beating their breasts.
Nineveh*ln is like a pool whose*ld waters run away. “Halt!*ln Halt!” they cry, but*ld none turns back.
Plunder*ln the silver, plunder*ld the gold! There*ln is no end of the treasure or*ld of the wealth of all precious things.
Desolate!*pn Desolation and ruin! Hearts*ld melt and knees tremble; anguish*ln is in all loins; all*ld faces grow pale!
Where*ln is the lions’ den, the*ld feeding place of the young lions, where*ln the lion and lioness went, where*ld his cubs were, with none to disturb?
The*ln lion tore enough for his cubs and*ld strangled prey for his lionesses; he*ln filled his caves with prey and*ld his dens with torn flesh.

Behold,*p I am against you, declares the Lord*s of hosts, and I will burn your chariots in smoke, and the sword shall devour your young lions. I will cut off your prey from the earth, and the voice of your messengers shall no longer be heard.
